meanings.definition: A thick, hard crust that forms over a wound as it heals.
meanings.sent1: The eschar protected the wound from further harm.
meanings.sent2: The doctor carefully removed the eschar to clean the wound.
meanings.sent3: The eschar looked like a shield guarding the wound.
meanings.sent4: The eschar was a natural armor for the healing skin.
meanings.sent5: The dark eschar contrasted sharply with the pink skin underneath.

meanings.sent1: The burn will eschar over time.
meanings.sent2: If you touch a hot pan, your skin may eschar.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally eschared my finger on the stove.
meanings.sent4: The fire's heat seemed to eschar the wood.
meanings.sent5: The scorching sun threatened to eschar my skin.
